text: Lewis Gilbert, CBE (6 March 1920 - 23 February 2018) was a British movie director, producer and screenwriter. He has directed more than 40 movies during six decades. He is known for his movies; Reach for the Sky (1956), Sink the Bismarck! (1960), Alfie (1966), Educating Rita (1983) and Shirley Valentine (1989), as well as three James Bond movies: You Only Live Twice (1967), The Spy Who Loved Me (1977) and Moonraker (1979). Gilbert was born in London, England."Lewis Gilbert (1920)", BFI screenonline Retrieved 14 April 2012 He died at home in Monaco on 23 February 2018, aged 97. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1920 births Category:2018 deaths Category:James Bond movie directors Category:Movie directors from London Category:Movie producers from London Category:Screenwriters from London
